title: Eddie Van Halen just died. Does anyone else like his music? - Quora

response.answer_text: What influence did Eddie Van Halen have on the electric guitar? There has never been a guitar player quite like Eddie Van Halen.When Van Halen's eponymous debut hit the shelves in February of 1978 (the band rounded out with Eddie's brother, Alex on drums, Micheal Anthony, and David Lee Roth), the prevailing rock guitar sound and scene was unexpectedly hit with something of seismic proportion. The fire and fury that was Edward's playing, the fluid legato runs, the white hot pentatonics, tremolo picking, screaming artificial harmonics, whammy tricks and dive bombs, volume swells, choppy flanges, his uniquely original other-worldly two handed tapping, all at top modded-Marshall volume, drenched in reverb, his unique ‘brown’ sound… Eddie took over where the imaginations of Eric Clapton and Jimi Hendrix had left off, he took everything that rock guitar was known to be and he flipped it on its’ head - smiling his inimitable smile, making it look easy the entire time.

The music world has lost one of it’s best ever guitarists. Van Halen exploded onto the rock scene in the late 70s with what is considered by many to be the greatest debut album in history - the self titled Van Halen - legend has it that they recorded the whole thing in one week.
Of course, other people love his music, how couldn't they? He is one of the greatest and most influential guitarists of all time, and his music will be listened to for many years to come.
Yes. I like his music a lot.
